question: Tert-butyl methyl ether + HI -> A + B. A and B respectively are
images/reaction_q29.png
choices: A = CH3OH, B = Tert-butyl iodide (Repeat option?)
A = CH3-I, B = Tert-butyl iodide (Incorrect structure)
explanation: The reaction of tert-butyl methyl ether with HI proceeds via SN1 mechanism because the tert-butyl carbocation is stable. Thus, Iodide attacks the tert-butyl group forming tert-butyl iodide and methanol is the leaving group [cite: 891-917].
